title: How to Make a Cauldron in Minecraft

steps.title: Create or find 7 Iron Ingots.
steps.content: Create or find 7 Iron Ingots. You will 7 Iron Ingots in order to craft a Cauldron. You can find Iron Ingots in Fortresses and Dungeons, and Iron Golems drop them, but you may find it easier to craft them yourself from Iron Ore. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mine Iron Ore.
steps.content: Mine Iron Ore. You will need a Stone Pickaxe or better in order to break Iron Ore blocks. You can find Iron Ore underground, and it is one of the most common metals. It can usually be found between layers 1 - 63, and will be in a vein of 4 - 10 blocks. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Create a Furnace if you don't have one yet.
steps.content: Create a Furnace if you don't have one yet. If you want to make the ingots yourself, you'll need a furnace to smelt the Iron Ore. Place 8 Cobblestone blocks around the edges of the Crafting window to make the furnace.

steps.title: Open the Furnace window and place Fuel in the bottom box.
steps.content: Open the Furnace window and place Fuel in the bottom box. You can use any type of Fuel when making Iron Ingots. Lava Buckets, Coal, and Charcoal make for the most efficient fuels, but you can also use Wood Blocks, any object made from wood (crafting table, chair, etc.), and saplings.

steps.title: Place a block of Iron Ore in the box above the Fuel.
steps.content: Place a block of Iron Ore in the box above the Fuel. After a few moments, an Iron Ingot will appear in the box on the right. Repeat until you have 7 Iron Ingots. More efficient fuel will allow you to craft your ingots much quicker.

steps.title: Open the Crafting window by using your Crafting Table.
steps.content: Open the Crafting window by using your Crafting Table. Once you have your Iron Ingots, you can create the Cauldron from the Crafting Table.

steps.title: Place three Ingots along the left side, three along the right, and one at the bottom.
steps.content: Place three Ingots along the left side, three along the right, and one at the bottom. The Ingots should form a "U" shape in the Crafting window.

steps.title: Drag the Cauldron from the Crafting window to your inventory.
steps.content: Drag the Cauldron from the Crafting window to your inventory. You can then place the Cauldron anywhere in the world.

steps.title: Use the Cauldron to brew potions in the Nether.
steps.content: Use the Cauldron to brew potions in the Nether. The Cauldron doesn't have a whole lot of uses, but it is very important for spending time in the Nether. This is because it's the one of the only ways to get water to make your potions. [3] X Research source Take your Cauldron to your outpost in the Nether. Return to the surface and fill as many Buckets as you can carry with water. Place all of your water Buckets in a Chest near your Cauldron in your Nether outpost. Fill the Cauldron with water using a Bucket. You'll be able to fill three Glass Bottles with water before you'll need to refill the cauldron with another Bucket.

steps.title: Use Cauldrons as rain barrels.
steps.content: Use Cauldrons as rain barrels. If you're settled in an arid area, you may not have many water sources close at hand. The Cauldron can come to the rescue and collect rainwater for you. Just place a few cauldrons outside, and they'll fill up the next time it rains.

steps.title: Use the Cauldron to douse flaming people (including yourself).
steps.content: Use the Cauldron to douse flaming people (including yourself). If you find yourself on fire more often than you'd like, you can hop into a Cauldron to put the flames out. just make sure it has water in it first!

steps.title: Decorate your house with Cauldrons.
steps.content: Decorate your house with Cauldrons. If you want your Minecraft home to look a little more authentic, place a Cauldron in the crafting area and keep it full. This will make it feel more useful and active.

steps.title: Wash the dyes off of your leather armor.
steps.content: Wash the dyes off of your leather armor. If you don't like the color of your armor anymore, you can wash it off by holding the armor and then using the Cauldron. You can also do this to remove the top layer of a banner. You could also dye leather by putting dye of any color in the cauldron (turning the water that color) and then tapping/clicking the cauldron with any type of leather armour. You can also combine dyes in cauldrons to make different shades of water.
